page.title: 11Arts, Lancaster University
page.content: The university lays on a varied musical programme in the Great Hall from classical music to pop groups. You can even attend lunch time concerts in term time. There is a Fine Art Department in the university which exhibits some of the students' work in the Scott Gallery. The exhibition provides a fascinating glimpse of the development of individual ideas and skill over the three year visual arts degree. Students studying for the degree may choose from four main areas; painting, sculpture, graphic and product design. The Nuffield Theatre has a variety of the best of dance, drama, mime, jazz and cabaret. The theatre studio is at the north end of the campus next to the Great Hall. The students have many clubs such as poetry reading, Gilbert and Sullivan, Music Society, TV and review groups.
